captions.text:
- Peering down the bottle
at what color this is
I'm like a little suspect of it.

- Can we say the thing
we think it looks like?
- It tastes just like a bunch of
melted Haribo gummies in dirty water.
- I would definitely buy this at the store
because it's so tiny and I would love

to just carry it around
and have people comment.

- Oh, it packs a punch.
- It's like liquid Smarties.
- It does like a little bit of Red Bull.
- It's an entirely new taste to me.

- Cool, I see Hello Kitty
and I know Hello Kitty.

on how to open it.
- There's some down here too.
- Place opener on top of a Ramune bottle
and press down firmly with your palm.

At this point, lunch is
over, my lunch break is over.
- Yeah, that's the worst one yet.

- I really like it, actually
it reminds me of the
- This tastes like Jones Soda to me.
- I think, like, mixing this with alcohol
at a party would be fun.
- I noticed you just poured more of this.
- I think there's a chemical in this
that's controlling my brain more than me.
- It kinda smells like rotting fruit.

- Oh goddammit.
- Wow, that's very unpleasant.

- Kind of a sour,
(snapping) sparkling cider.

- Yeah, this makes my
tongue wanna leave my mouth.

- Like apple puree for babies.
- Yes!

That's exactly what it is!
- It's like a baby food.

- [Voiceover] I have arrived,
I shall take one tiny beer.

- Are you enjoying the
giant football game?
Throw me one of that tiny six-pack.
- Here, one tiny beer for you.

comments.text:
For anyone wondering the umeshu drink (described as smelling like rotten 
fruit) is a drink that is umeboshi flavored. Umeboshi are salted pickled 
plums and eaten by themselves or in other dishes. I'm surprised that they 
tried it considering that most umeshu drinks I've seen sold are alcoholic 
(the one they tried has 0% though).﻿

try too hard on that hipster look, it just looks forced and costumey.

about what I think.﻿
